intro: Moniera repens, commonly known as the creeping moniera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes and form a dense mat. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Moniera repens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
